question: I haven't been to the gym for 2 weeks...How screwed am I and how long will it take for me?
question_content: I might be out for another 2 weeks but I don't know yet, depends on how my leg is

answers.answer_content:
Depends on your age and how long you had been exercising regularly before you stopped.  If you are in your 20's or younger and  had been working out regularly for more than a year, then you lost about 5% muscle strength and around 10% endurance (more if you had not been doing cardio).

Generally speaking, the quicker the gain, the quicker you lose it. The longer it took to gain, the longer it takes to lose it.  You are not too badly off.  Just remember to easy back into the routine once you re-start.  You do not want to injure yourself and have to take more time off.
